thread.title: Middle school swimmers, divers continue to hold own
thread.title_full: Middle school swimmers, divers continue to hold own

author:
Debbie Holmes 

Trail-Gazette
title: Middle school swimmers, divers continue to hold own
text:
Middle school swimmers, divers continue to hold own By Debbie Holmes Posted: 10/01/2015 11:53:36 AM MDT Click photo to enlarge Eighth-grader John Ferree keeps the Cats in the race with his strong breaststroke at the Bill Reed meet on Wednesday. « 3 » 
The Estes Park Middle School swimming and diving junior Cats continue to hold their own against teams three and four times their size. 
This year, the middle school diving team has rocked the boards. Amelia Westley has dominated every competition winning them all. 
New to diving this year, Ben Ferree and Nathan Fitzpatrick have also finished in the top three at every meet. The boys have learned their nine dives in seven short weeks of practice, something that is hard to do. 
The eighth-grade team of Zoe Hester, Monica Luttrell (who attends Lyons Middle School but swims for Estes), Steele Wolf, John Ferree and Nathan Richardson have had a good season with many wins and top finishes. As leaders of the team they've set a great example of how to compete well against the odds. 
The swimmers are looking to finishing well in their conference championship swim meet which will take place this Saturday, Oct. 3 at the Mountain View Aquatic Center in Loveland. Advertisement
